parsed.internal_thinking: I have placed my first settlement on Node 20, securing high-probability production of Wood (11), Brick (6), and Sheep (8). This provides a total of 12 pips and a solid resource base for early road building. I've decided to place my starting road toward Node 10. Node 10 is a high-value expansion spot with 11 total pips (B6, S8, W12) and, more importantly, it serves as the direct path to the 3:1 port at Node 9. Since my first settlement lacks Wheat and Ore, securing a flexible port early is vital for trading my surplus Brick and Sheep. This move also keeps me flexible for my second settlement, where I will prioritize high-yield Wheat and Ore spots like Nodes 42 or 43 to balance my economy. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: Expansion plan: Road to Node 10, then settlement on Node 10 or move to the 3:1 port at Node 9. Second settlement priority: Wheat and Ore (aim for Nodes 42, 43, or 31).
parsed.say_outloud: I'll point my road towards the coast. That 3:1 port looks like it might be useful later on, especially if I end up with as much Brick and Sheep as I'm hoping for!
